<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Truth-Tables">Truth Tables<a class="anchor-link" href="#Truth-Tables"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Logical Operations &amp; Decision Making</li>
<li>Definition: Truth tables show the results of combining boolean values to show the whether or not a condition can be true or false. For instance if you were to make a truth table for the condition of a person being able to vote you could make it so that the first column would be the age of the person and the second column would be whether or not they are a citizen. Then you could make it so that if the person is 18 or older and a citizen they can vote, if they are 18 or older and not a citizen they can not vote, if they are under 18 and a citizen they can not vote, and if they are under 18 and not a citizen they can not vote. This is an illustration of how truth tables can be used to make decisions in a program. However they can also be used when expressing other operations besides <em>and</em> such as <em>or</em>, <em>not</em>, and <em>xor</em>.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Truth-Tables-Code-Example">Truth Tables Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Truth-Tables-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">Truth_Table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">A</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">B</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">Logic</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">A</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">B</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">AND</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">A</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">B</span>
        <span class="n">OR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">A</span> <span class="ow">or</span> <span class="n">B</span>
        <span class="n">NOT</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="n">A</span>
        <span class="n">XOR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">A</span> <span class="o">^</span> <span class="n">B</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">AND</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">OR</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">NOT</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">XOR</span>
    <span class="n">AND</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">OR</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">NOT</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">XOR</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Logic</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">A</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">B</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">A</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">B</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">AND</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">OR</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">NOT</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">XOR</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;A</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="s2">B</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="s2">AND</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="s2">OR</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="s2">NOT</span><span class="se">\t</span><span class="s2">XOR&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Truth_Table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Truth_Table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Truth_Table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">Truth_Table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through a Truth Table the program is able to </span>
<span class="c1"># display the result of the logic gates AND, OR, NOT,</span>
<span class="c1"># and XOR. Illustrating how each gate functions. </span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>A	B	AND	OR	NOT	XOR
True	False	False	True	False	True
False	True	False	True	True	True
False	False	False	False	True	False
True	True	True	True	False	False
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<h2 id="Charectors">Charectors<a class="anchor-link" href="#Charectors"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Strings &amp; String Operations</li>
<li>Definition: A character is a symbol that represents a letter, number, or other character. They are used to represent all kinds of itmes including special charectors and spaces. Ex. !@#$%^&amp;*()_+{}|:"&lt;&gt;?`~[]\;',./ are all charectors. Charectors can be stored in strings in python.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Charectors-Code-Example">Charectors Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Charectors-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">charectors</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What is your word?&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your word is </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">charector</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">word</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">charector</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> has the ASCII code </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="nb">ord</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">charector</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">charectors</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1"># This program showcases charectors stored in a string which it </span>
<span class="c1"># then iterates through printing the ASCII code that each </span>
<span class="c1"># charector correlates to.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

b has the ASCII code 98
u has the ASCII code 117
t has the ASCII code 116
t has the ASCII code 116
e has the ASCII code 101
r has the ASCII code 114
</pre>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Strings">Strings<a class="anchor-link" href="#Strings"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Strings &amp; String Operations</li>
<li>Definition: Strings are a datatype that is used to store text in a program. For instance if you were to make a program that would ask the user for their name and then print out a message saying hello to them you could use a string to store the users name. </li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Strings-Code-Example">Strings Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Strings-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">Things</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">3.23</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;Cheese&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">]]</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">string_check</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Things</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">thing</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">Things</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">isinstance</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">thing</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">thing</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> is a string&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">thing</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> is not a string&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">string_check</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Things</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>1 is not a string
3.23 is not a string
Cheese is a string
True is not a string
5 is not a string
[1, 2, 3] is not a string
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<h2 id="Length">Length<a class="anchor-link" href="#Length"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Strings &amp; String Operations</li>
<li>Definition: Length is represented by the len() function in Python and can be used to find the lenth of a string, tuple, dictionary, list, or range.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Length-Code-Example">Length Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Length-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">words1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;apple&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;banana&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;cherry&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;durian&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;elderberry&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;fig&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;grape&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;huckleberry&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;iris&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;jujube&quot;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">words2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;kiwi&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;lemon&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;mango&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;nectarine&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;orange&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;pear&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;quince&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;raspberry&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;strawberry&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;tangerine&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;watermelon&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;xigua&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;yam&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;zucchini&quot;</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">parser</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&lt;=</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">words</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> has </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> letters&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;ERROR: Too many words&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">parser</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words2</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">parser</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>ERROR: Too many words
apple has 5 letters
banana has 6 letters
cherry has 6 letters
durian has 6 letters
elderberry has 10 letters
fig has 3 letters
grape has 5 letters
huckleberry has 11 letters
iris has 4 letters
jujube has 6 letters

<h2 id="Concatenation">Concatenation<a class="anchor-link" href="#Concatenation"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Strings &amp; String Operations</li>
<li>Definition: Concatenation is combining two or more strings into one larger string.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Concatenation-Code-Example">Concatenation Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Concatenation-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">concatenator</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="n">words</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    <span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Enter a word or press enter to stop: &quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">while</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">words</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Enter a word or press enter to stop: &quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;The words concatenated together are: &quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">end</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot; &quot;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="n">concatenator</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of the join function the program is able to</span>
<span class="c1"># take a list of words and then join them together into a string</span>
<span class="c1"># through string concatenation.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

</pre>

    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your orginal string was: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your yelling string is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">upper</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">!!!&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">Yeller</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1"># Input string all uppercase and then print</span>

<h2 id="Traversing-Strings">Traversing Strings<a class="anchor-link" href="#Traversing-Strings"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Strings &amp; String Operations</li>
<li>Definition: Traversing a string is the ability to access each individual charector in a string. As each charector is an iterable object in python you can use a for loop to access each individual charector in a string.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Traversing-Strings-Code-Example">Traversing Strings Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Traversing-Strings-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">seperator</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What is your word?&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your orginal string was: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your seperated string is: &quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">charector</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">word</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">charector</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">seperator</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1"># Through using a for loop the program is able</span>
<span class="c1"># to iterate through the string and print each</span>
<span class="c1"># charector on a new line.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

b
u
t
t
e
r
</pre>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Python-If">Python If<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-If"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Conditional Statements</li>
<li>Definition: The If statment is a conditional statement that is used to create condition if met will execute a block of code. For instance if you were to make a program that would prompt the user for a certain word if it was of a certain length it would print out a message saying that the word was of the correct length. </li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Python-If-Code-Example">Python If Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-If-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">

    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your word </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was not in the word bank&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;decrement&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;definition&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;degradation&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;delegation&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;delimiter&quot;</span><span <span class="s2">&quot;inheritance&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;initialization&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;input&quot;</span><span <span class="s2">&quot;machine&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;management&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;manipulation&quot;</span><span class="s2">&quot;measurement&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;method&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;middleware&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;migration&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;model&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;modification&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;module&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;monitoring&quot;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What word do you want to check?&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">word_guesser</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">word</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of the if statement the program is able to execute</span>
<span class="c1"># a block of code informing the user that thier word is in their</span>
<span class="c1"># word is in the word bank or not if the condition that the word is </span>
<span class="c1"># in the word bank is met. If it is not met the else statemtent </span>
<span class="c1"># executes and informs the user that the word is not in the word bank.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</pre>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Elif">Elif<a class="anchor-link" href="#Elif"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Conditional Statements</li>
<li>Defintion: Elif or Else If is a conditional statement that is used to create a condition if met will execute a block of code. However it is used after an if statement and can be used to create multiple conditions. An example could be if there was a correct word and you had a game where the user had to guess a word of the same length if their word was too long or too short it would print out a message saying that the word was too long or too short.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Elif-Code-Example">Elif Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Elif-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">word_guesser</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">while</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">guess</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What word do you want to check?&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your guess </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">guess</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was the correct length&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">break</span>
        <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">guess</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your guess </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">guess</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was too long&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your guess </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">guess</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was too short&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;abstraction&quot;</span>
<span class="n">word_guesser</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of elif statment the porgram is able to </span>
<span class="c1"># Excute a different block of code depending on if a </span>
<span class="c1"># another condition is true other than just having an</span>
<span class="c1"># else statment in this case it woud alows the program</span>
<span class="c1"># to check if the guess is too long or too short not just</span>
<span class="c1"># if it is the wrong length.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Your guess truffles was too short
Your guess butter was too short
Your guess gamer was too short
Your guess butterscotch was too long
Your guess abstraction was the correct length
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Else-Conditionals">Else Conditionals<a class="anchor-link" href="#Else-Conditionals"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Conditional Statements</li>
<li>Definiton: Else is a conditional statement that will execute if the other condtion is not met so if the condition of an if statement is not met it will execute the other block of code.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Else-Conditionals-Code-Example">Else Conditionals Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Else-Conditionals-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">addition_game</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numbers</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What is your first number?&quot;</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">num2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What is your second number?&quot;</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">num2</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">numbers</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your answer </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was in the list of numbers&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your answer </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was not in the list of numbers&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">numbers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">9</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">13</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">16</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">17</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">18</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">19</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">addition_game</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numbers</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of the else statment the program is able to able </span>
<span class="c1"># print that the sum of the users two numbers is not in the list of</span>
<span class="c1"># numbers as the if condition that the sum of the two numbers is in</span>
<span class="c1"># the list of numbers is not met.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Your answer 53 was not in the list of numbers
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Nested-Selection-Statement">Nested Selection Statement<a class="anchor-link" href="#Nested-Selection-Statement"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Conditional Statements</li>
<li>Definition: Nested selection statements are used to allow for more complicated logic in programs so to create a condition if another condition is also true. </li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Nested-Selection-Statement-Code-Example">Nested Selection Statement Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Nested-Selection-Statement-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_compare</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was greater than your second number </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number was also positive&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number was also negative&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num2</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your second number was also positive&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your second number was also negative&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">&lt;</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was less than your second number </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num2</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your second number was also positive&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your second number was also negative&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number was also positive&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number was also negative&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your first number </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was equal to your second number </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your numbers were also positive&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Your numbers were also negative&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">number_compare</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of having mutliple nested </span>
<span class="c1"># selection statements the program is able to </span>
<span class="c1"># determine which number is larger of the two</span>
<span class="c1"># along with the sign of the numbers. This is </span>
<span class="c1"># possible as the program can have multiple </span>
<span class="c1"># if statements within the selection statements </span>
<span class="c1"># allowing multiple sub-conditions to be met.</span>
<span class="c1"># </span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Your first number -1 was less than your second number 1
Your second number was also positive
Your first number was also negative
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Python-For">Python For<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-For"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Loops &amp; Iteration</li>
<li>Definition: The For loop is a loop that is used to repeat a block of code a certain number of times. For instance you could write a program that would iterate through a list of numbers and print out each number in the list.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Python-For-Code-Example">Python For Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-For-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">wonders</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span>
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Great Pyramid of Giza&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">29.9792</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">31.1342</span><span class="p">),</span> 
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Hanging Gardens of Babylon&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">32.5350</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">44.4270</span><span class="p">),</span> 
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Temple of Artemis at Ephesus&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">37.9279</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">27.3506</span><span class="p">),</span> 
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Statue of Zeus at Olympia&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">37.6275</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">21.6405</span><span class="p">),</span> 
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Mausoleum of Halicarnassus&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">37.0353</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">27.4162</span><span class="p">),</span> 
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Colossus of Rhodes&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">36.4450</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">28.2269</span><span class="p">),</span> 
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Lighthouse of Alexandria&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">31.2156</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">29.9456</span><span class="p">)]</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">wonder_Location</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wonders</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">wonder</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">wonders</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">wonder</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> is located at </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">wonder</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">, </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">wonder</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">wonder_Location</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wonders</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of a for loop the program is able to iterate through</span>
<span class="c1"># the iterables in the list which are tuples and be able to print the</span>
<span class="c1"># name of the wonder along with the latitude and longitude of the wonder. </span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Great Pyramid of Giza is located at 29.9792, 31.1342
Hanging Gardens of Babylon is located at 32.535, 44.427
Temple of Artemis at Ephesus is located at 37.9279, 27.3506
Statue of Zeus at Olympia is located at 37.6275, 21.6405
Mausoleum of Halicarnassus is located at 37.0353, 27.4162
Colossus of Rhodes is located at 36.445, 28.2269
Lighthouse of Alexandria is located at 31.2156, 29.9456
</pre>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="While-Loops-With-Range">While Loops With Range<a class="anchor-link" href="#While-Loops-With-Range"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Loops &amp; Iteration</li>
<li>Definition: A while loops is a kind of loop that iterates while a condition is true this could be used with range in a way so you can iterate a certain number of times. For instance using this kind of loop you would be able to iterate only 5 times to only execute a certain block of code that amount of times such as a print statement.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="While-Loops-With-Range-Code-Example">While Loops With Range Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#While-Loops-With-Range-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">printer</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">message</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">while</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">&lt;</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">message</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

<span class="n">printer</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;Hello World&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># Through the use of a while loop</span>
<span class="c1"># with range you are able to </span>
<span class="c1"># print the message only 5 times</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Hello World
Hello World
Hello World
Hello World
Hello World
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="List-Combining-Loops-With-Conditionals-To-Break">List Combining Loops With Conditionals To Break<a class="anchor-link" href="#List-Combining-Loops-With-Conditionals-To-Break"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Loops &amp; Iteration</li>
<li>Definition: You can combine loops with conditionals that could prematurly terminate that loop if it were to be iterating through a list if a certain condition was met.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="List-Combining-Loops-With-Conditionals-To-Break-Code-Example">List Combining Loops With Conditionals To Break Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#List-Combining-Loops-With-Conditionals-To-Break-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">words</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;hello&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;world&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;spam&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;eggs&quot;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">word_search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">loops</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">words</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">rsp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What word do you want to check?&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">rsp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strip</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">words</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">rsp</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was found after </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">loops</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> loops&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">break</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">rsp</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> was not found after </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">loops</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> loops&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">loops</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

<span class="n">word_search</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of a for loop which iterates </span>
<span class="c1"># through the list of words and conditionals </span>
<span class="c1"># within the program is able end the loop</span>
<span class="c1"># once the word is found before the loop is done</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>gamer was not found after 0 loops
butter was not found after 1 loops
world was found after 2 loops
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Continue">Continue<a class="anchor-link" href="#Continue"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Loops &amp; Iteration</li>
<li>Definition: Continue is a keyword which is used to skip the current iteration and move on to the next one. For instance if you were to make a program that would iterate through a list of numbers and print out all the even numbers you could use continue to skip the odd numbers.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Continue-Code-Example">Continue Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Continue-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">==</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">continue</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of the continue statement</span>
<span class="c1"># the program is able to skip the even numbers</span>
<span class="c1"># and only print the odd numbers</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>1
3
5
7
9
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Without the use of the continue statement</span>
<span class="c1"># The program only printed the even numbers</span>
<span class="c1"># as without continue they were not skipped</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>0
2
4
6
8
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Procedural-Abstraction">Procedural Abstraction<a class="anchor-link" href="#Procedural-Abstraction"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Algorythms</li>
<li>Definition: Procedural Abstraction is about creating a simplifed interface for a more complex operation. Which is done by breaking things up into smaller componenents and steps to be able to deal with complex problems more easily and also being able to resure code through spliting it up into smaller more managable functions. </li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Procedural-Abstraction-Code-Example">Procedural Abstraction Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Procedural-Abstraction-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">numbers</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__init__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">num1</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">num2</span>
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_adder</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_subtractor</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_multiplier</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_divider</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_exponent</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">**</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span>
    
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__str__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;num1: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> and num2: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> are the numbers being used&quot;</span>

<span class="n">nums</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">numbers</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;The numbers added together is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">number_adder</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;The numbers subtracted together is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">number_subtractor</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;The numbers multiplied together is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">number_multiplier</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;The numbers divded from each other are: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">number_divider</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;The num1 to the power of num2 is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">nums</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">number_exponent</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of procedural abstaction the more complex</span>
<span class="c1"># functions are abstracted into smaller functions which are</span>
<span class="c1"># easier to understand and read as well as being able to be</span>
<span class="c1"># used by the user of the program.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>num1: 3 and num2: 7 are the numbers being used
The numbers added together is: 10
The numbers subtracted together is: -4
The numbers multiplied together is: 21
The numbers divded from each other are: 0.43
The num1 to the power of num2 is: 2187
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Python-Def-Procedures">Python Def Procedures<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-Def-Procedures"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Algorythms</li>
<li>Definition: A def procedure is the way functions are defined in Python and are used to create blocks of code that perform certain actions which can be executed at a later date. For innstance you would be able to create a function using a def procedure that could add two numbers than call that function in other application during your program.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Python-Def-Procedures-Code-Example">Python Def Procedures Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Python-Def-Procedures-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">hello_there</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Hello there </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">friend</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">input</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;What is your name?&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">hello_there</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">friend</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">friend</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1"># Through the use of a def procudure the </span>
<span class="c1"># same block of code is able to be used </span>
<span class="c1"># multiple times without having to rewrite</span>
<span class="c1"># the same code over and over again. </span>
<span class="c1"># Seen in the way both people could be </span>
<span class="c1"># greeted with the same code.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">

<div class="output_area">

<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Hello there Jhonny Silverstone
Hello there Jhonny Appleseed
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
    {% endraw %}

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Parameters">Parameters<a class="anchor-link" href="#Parameters"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Algorythms</li>
<li>Definition: Parameters are variables that are used to pass information into a function. For instance if you were to make a function that would add two numbers the parameters of the function would be the two values.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Parameters-Code-Example">Parameters Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Parameters-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_adder</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> and </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> added together is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">number_subtractor</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> subtracted by </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> is: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">num1</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">num2</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">number_adder</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">33</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">27</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">number_subtractor</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">69</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">420</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the adding and subtraction </span>
<span class="c1"># functions it can be seen through </span>
<span class="c1"># the use of parameters in the values</span>
<span class="c1"># that are passed through the functions</span>
<span class="c1"># that are able to be used in the functions</span>
<span class="c1"># to be able to perform thier repective operations.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Return-Values">Return Values<a class="anchor-link" href="#Return-Values"> </a></h2><ul>
<li>Category: Algorythms</li>
<li>Definition: Return values are values that are returned from a function once it has completed exeuction. For instance if you were to create function which added two numbers together once the function had completed execution it would return the sum of the two numbers. In Python this is represented by the return keyword.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="Return-Values-Code-Example">Return Values Code Example<a class="anchor-link" href="#Return-Values-Code-Example"> </a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
    {% raw %}
    
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">

<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">Rectangle</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__init__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">length</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">height</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">length</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">length</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">width</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">height</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">height</span>
    
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">volume</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">volume</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">length</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">height</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">volume</span>
    
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">surface_area</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">surface_area</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">length</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">length</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">height</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">height</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">surface_area</span>
    
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__str__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Rectanglular Prism: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">length</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> ft x </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">width</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> ft x </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">height</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> ft&quot;</span>

<span class="n">rect</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Rectangle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rect</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Volume: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">volume</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> ft^3&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Surface Area: </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">surface_area</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> ft^2&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Through the use of return statmnts in the functions</span>
<span class="c1"># the program is able to return the values of the </span>
<span class="c1"># created for are and volume respectively after the</span>
<span class="c1"># functions has completed executing. Which allows </span>
<span class="c1"># the program to be able to print the values the </span>
<span class="c1"># functions return.</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>
